intro: Marathrum chiriferum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marathrum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small yellow flowers in the summer months. Marathrum chiriferum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions.
